programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and special guest, the author Tim Ferriss, travel to the remote north slope of Alaska's Brooks Range to catch the annual migration of the famed Western Arctic caribou herd. On the open tundra they fish, hunt and fight off marauding grizzlies. With caribou bulls on the menu, they'll feast on a stew of caribou sirloin and root vegetables thickened with bone marrow.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: After drawing one of the most coveted big game tags in North America ‚Äì a Tok Management Area Dall sheep tag ‚Äì Steven Rinella heads out for a truly rare and epic Alaskan experience. Along with his brother Danny and friend Paul, Steve is dropped deep into the Alaska Range. After a rugged hike through nasty weather, Steve‚Äôs skills and fortitude are tested against his elusive, high-climbing quarry.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella crosses the border into Mexico's desert to call in the Gould‚Äôs wild turkey. Of the five turkey subspecies in North America, the Gould‚Äôs is the largest but rarest. On this unique Mexican adventure, Steve finds exciting action for gobbling toms. With locally made charcoal at his disposal, he'll grill up a big, brined, delicious bird.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and his friend Ronny Boehme drive into the mountains of southwest Montana to hunt the high ridge tops for dusky grouse. Ronny‚Äôs Bracco Italiano hunting dogs have been bred and trained for this work, but can Ronny handle the altitude? The duo prepares dusky grouse jalape√±o poppers and grouse fettuccine with a white wine and cream sauce.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: The goal on MeatEater has always been to make viewers feel like they‚Äôre on a hunt with Steven Rinella, but on this two-part episode Rinella grants his viewers an all-access pass to see just how the MeatEater crew works together to make the show. Strap-in for some behind-the-scenes action.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Television personality Joe Rogan and his best friend, comedian Bryan Callen, join Steven Rinella for their very first hunt. On a float trip for mule deer through the rugged Missouri Breaks, this is as adventurous of a first hunt as anyone could hope for, and Steve‚Äôs special guests are in for a memorable experience and delicious wild game field cooking in some gorgeous country.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella returns to his cherished boyhood stomping grounds along Michigan‚Äôs Muskegon River. He'll paddle his canoe through the marsh to camp and bow fish for sucker, bowfin, and gar. With the rich bounty of overlooked aquatic foods that can be found in this freshwater paradise, he'll demonstrate how beat the heat by salt curing fish and later he'll prepare a camp meal of fried gar.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and friend Cody Lujan head to Northeastern New Mexico to hunt pronghorn antelope, the fastest big game animal in the United States. In the wide open desert plains, Steve will have to work hard to stalk within range of a mature buck. The payoff will be antelope loin topped with local New Mexico chiles.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this cooking special, Steven Rinella shows his fans some of his favorite preparations for big, bone-in cuts of red meat. Interspersed with highlights from his recent caribou, buffalo, and mule deer hunts, the show features recipes that utilize some of the most underappreciated parts of big game animals. This episode is an attractive and delicious tribute to Steve‚Äôs gun-to-table ethic.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella returns to his favorite hunting grounds of Sonora, Mexico to hunt for a Coues deer buck during the peak rutting season. Steve sets up camp and spends days glassing mountains and canyons for these elusive, wary desert whitetails. Meanwhile, his hunting partner, Remi Warren, attempts the difficult task of stalking one with a bow. To cap off the hunt, Steve cooks a batch of venison ribs braised in a Dutch oven buried beneath hot coals.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode, Steven Rinella joins forces with fellow hunter and wild game chef Hank Shaw in the hills of Central California to go after Columbia blacktail deer, wild pigs, and a handful of small game species that are in season. The end result is a culinary smorgasbord of epic proportions.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve ventures out to his hunting and fishing shack on a remote coastline of southeast Alaska‚Äôs Prince of Wales Island. While hunting bears from a skiff and a canoe, Steve gathers a variety of prime seafood and makes a discovery about his own motivations as a bear hunter.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella breaks down an entire boar and shares some of his favorite recipes in this Cooking Special. Matt Weingarter helps steve make head cheese, pork skin cracklins, smoked pork butt, and a tied-roast boned-out ham. Each dish requires thoughtful butchering, processing, and cooking to execute to perfection.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan float a remote river on a bull moose hunt in the wilderness of British Columbia. Here, they'll face one of the most dangerous moments in Steve‚Äôs life as a hunter. But they'll also enjoy one the best wild game meals they've ever tasted.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve must deal with bad weather and fierce competition during a late-season central Montana elk hunt. With some tips from a friend, Steve encounters plenty of elk on this public land hunt. But he'll have to hike hard in steep country and deep snow to get to the elk and away from other hunters.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and his buddy Ryan Callaghan, a British Columbia guide, hike into the steep backcountry of northern British Columbia in search of grizzlies and black bears. Among the beutiful alpine vista, this adventure includes some intense and up-close bear action ‚Äì almost too close.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Romance Is Dead

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.title: Friend Or Foe
programme.desc: In Lexington, Kentucky, a newly wed wife parties like there's no tomorrow until a body is dumped on a golf course. In Brisbane, Australia, a mannequin on the street highlights there are fears for the safety of a missing wife.

programme.title: Romance Is Dead
programme.desc: In Poughkeepsie, New York, a Police officer discovers evidence his wife is guilty of cheating on him leading to a deadly encounter, while in Orlando, Florida, a newly wed wife gets herself a boy toy with fatal results.

programme.title: Operation Diablos: Two Wheel Traffickers
programme.desc: FBI agent Mark Pocoro infiltrates the Diablos motorcycle gang, which is involved in various criminal activities from drugs to stolen cars. The case takes a sudden turn when the gang leader solicits Pocoro to murder a police officer who's getting too close to the organization. Pocoro stalls the murder while collecting evidence against their criminal operation. But can he stall the gang, or will they take matters into their own hands?

programme.title: Operation Vinnie The Plumber: Defusing A Bomber
programme.desc: When a bomb is detonated under a police car, ATF agent Vince Cefalu goes undercover to get the suspect. Cefalu becomes a disgruntled dirt bag and hires the bomber to build him some bombs. The suspect takes the bait and Cefalu picks up the explosives just before a take-down. But will he be made as a cop and have the case blow up on him?

programme.desc: Reporting from inside the U.S. military's grueling Arctic training war games as the region becomes a high-stakes global battleground. In this frozen proving ground, survival skills are as vital as firepower.

programme.desc: An inside look into the Ukrainian FPV Kamikaze drone unit hunting Russian soldiers on the frontlines.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: The Pasta Queen, Nadia Caterina Munno, starts her culinary tour of Italy in the region of Puglia. Come along as she makes two classic Pugliese dishes: Orecchiette con Pomodoro e Cacioricotta and Cozze alla Tarantina. Alongside these two recipes, she dives further into two key ingredients for the recipes with Bari’s Pasta Ladies and Taranto’s mussel fishermen.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: On her final stop in Puglia, Nadia explores the town of Altamura where she learns how to make their world-famous bread. In Bari, Nadia meets with Massimo, the President of the Accademia dell’Assassina. His job is to protect and promote the famous Spaghetti all’Assassina or “Assassin’s Spaghetti.” Nadia unveils two killer recipes: Peperonata Crostini and the deadly Spaghetti All’Assassina.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: The Pasta Queen continues through the region of Puglia with her Dad, Tonino, visiting an olive oil mill to learn about Extra Virgin Olive Oil. Later, they visit an ancient trabucco, an old fishing machine, and discover how the seaside towns of Puglia used to catch their seafood. Alongside these adventures, Nadia makes two delicious dishes from Puglia: Focaccia Pugliese and Linguine Al Cartoccio.

programme.title: Recipe for Success with Chrissy Teigen
